result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Antonio Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Corut orders the $500 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

11:28 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

$250 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the $500 cash bond  on file be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 11:32 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-15-2015 11:00 am

11:58 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has had no contact with the defendant since the last hearing and is waiting on Discovery.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 15, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  Defendant's appearance is Mandatory or warrant will be issued.

Court adjourned at 11:59 a.m.

3:17 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant does not qualify for PD representation.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing at the same time when Atty Zamzow will be here.

Court adjourned at 3:20 p.m.
